comments:
Not sure if this is a duplicate of 54292 or 54198, but opening a new bugzilla 
just in case...

Steps to reproduce:
-------------------
1. Start Eclipse from a new workspace.
2. File -> Import -> Log File
3. Add the access.log and error.log files from the examples (the Apache Http 
server logs) to the default log set. Click Finish to import these log files.
4. In the Log Navigator view, right click on Correlations -> New -> Log 
Correlation. Select Log Correlation in the resulting wizard, and click next.
5. Select the two logs from the "Available Logs" table and move them over to 
the "Selected Logs" table. Click Next.
6. Select Default Time as the correlation schema, and click Finish.
7. In the Log Navigator view, right click on the new correlation -> Open With -
> Log Interractions.
8. In the Log Navigator view, right click on the new correlation -> Delete.
9. Right click on an empty area in the Log Interractions view -> Filter Log 
Record.
10. Add a new filter: "severity", "=", "50". Click OK.

At this point, the GUI does nothing (filter pop-up doesn't go away). In 
the .log file, you will find this...

This is related to bug 54198, which is fix on 20040309. please verify the bug 
in the next tasspass

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 54198 ***
I don't recall seeing this anymore in the recent testpasses. Closing bug...
